itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, Feb. 10, 2015
teaser: Airing Tuesday, February 9, 2015: Who would have thought? News of yet another investigation into a Swiss bank helping Americans hide money. Dr Pepper’s stock is on a tear, while Coke and Pepsi, not so much. Why are the behemoths of the soda business lagging behind the upstart. And South Florida is worrying about the rising ocean flooding much of it and ruining drinking water for what’s left, but you’d never know it from the condo boom in Miami. Why do they keep building like mad? The condos aren’t homes, they’re speculative financial instruments attracting foreign buyers.
byline: D Gorenstein, Dan Weissmann, Adam Allington, Nancy Marshall-Genzer, David Brancaccio and Erin Toner

title: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, Feb. 10, 2015
